messages.title: Trident
messages.content: Josh Mason says, 'YES.' Labour and Jeremy Corbyn says, 'NO.'

messages.title: Brexit
messages.content: Josh Mason says, 'It's our biggest priority. So YES.' Labour can't make up their minds and follow Mrs May.

messages.title: The Monarchy
messages.content: Josh Mason says, 'I'm a Royalist.' Jeremy Corbyn says, 'I’m a Republican.'

messages.title: The Health Service
messages.content: Josh Mason says, 'Yes, of course, I oppose this.' Labour opened the door to privatisation in the 1990s.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Josh Mason wants to give every child and adult the opportunity to thrive and make sure our area has the skills for the future.
Josh Mason supports people in need and criticises Labour's candidate for not voting against Conservative cuts to vulnerable people.
Josh Mason has been fighting Labour Council's cuts for years and is committed to keeping libraries open, lights switched on, and green spaces protected.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Conservatives a distant fourth here. Only the Lib Dems have a record of beating Labour here.

issues.brexitEurope: Josh Mason sees Brexit as a top priority and supports maintaining Teesside's link with the UK's biggest trading partner.
issues.education: Josh Mason believes education is a top priority to provide opportunity and skills for the future. Criticizes Labour for 'unacceptably low' local student achievement.
issues.health: Josh Mason opposes the privatisation of the NHS and accuses Labour of opening the door to privatisation in the 1990s.

images.caption: Josh Mason campaign leaflet page with statements comparing his stance with Jeremy Corbyn's on various issues
